title: Russia and Ukraine Stage New Prisoner Exchange, Russian Defense Ministry, Ukraine President Say
description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged 146 prisoners of war from each side on Sunday after mediation by the United Arab Emirates, the Russian defense ministry and the Ukrainian president said.The Russian ministry said all of the freed Russians were in Belarus receiving psychological...
content:
Russia and Ukraine exchanged 146 prisoners of war from each side on Sunday after mediation by the United Arab Emirates, the Russian defense ministry and the Ukrainian president said.

The Russian ministry said all of the freed Russians were in Belarus receiving psychological and medical assistance.

Ukraine also returned to Moscow eight Russian citizens, residents of the Kursk region, the ministry said.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, writing on the Telegram messaging app, announced that the exchange had taken place, but gave no figures.

The president posted pictures of smiling returnees, saying most of them had been in captivity since 2022, when Russia invaded its smaller neighbor. He said a journalist taken prisoner a month after the invasion was among them.

Zelenskiy thanked the United Arab Emirates for its role in overseeing the swap.

"The exchanges are continuing. Perhaps that is possible because of our soldiers, who are increasing the exchange fund for Ukraine," the president wrote, referring to the capture of Russian servicemen.
summary: Russia and Ukraine have reportedly exchanged 146 prisoners of war, with the United Arab Emirates overseeing the exchange. The freed Russians are currently receiving psychological and medical assistance in Belarus. Ukraine returned eight Russian citizens to Moscow, with most having been held captive since the Russian invasion of Ukraine in 2000. The exchange took place without giving specific details.
shortSummary: Russia and Ukraine exchanged 146 prisoners, including some children, under United Arab Emirates mediation, with hopes for future cooperation.
argos_summary: Russia and Ukraine swapped 146 prisoners of war, with the UAE, Russian defense ministry and Ukrainian president mediating the exchange. All freed Russians are receiving psychological and medical assistance in Belarus, while Ukraine returned eight Russian citizens from the Kursk region. President Zelenskiy posted photos of the returnees, many of whom had been captive since 2022, and thanked the UAE for its role. He noted that exchanges continue, partly due to increased funds from captured Russian servicemen.
